snippet: Democrats delayed a vote on a bill giving legal protection to opponents of same-sex marriage, one of several such measures introduced since the Supreme Court’s ruling in June.
abstract: Missouri State Senate Democrats continue second day of filibuster against legislation granting new legal protection to opponents of same-sex marriage; supporters of bill cite religious freedom, while opponents point to discrimination.

byline.original: By AUSTIN HUGUELET and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Austin Huguelet reported from Jefferson City, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.

lead_paragraph: Democrats delayed a vote on a bill giving legal protection to opponents of same-sex marriage, one of several such measures introduced since the Supreme Court’s ruling in June.

headline.main: Missouri Senate Filibusters Against Bill Protecting Opponents of Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Filibuster in Missouri Senate Against Bill Protecting Same-Sex-Marriage Opponents

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
